The purpose of the patent is to provide a method for purifying recombinant HIV gp120 so as to provide a glycopeptide having protein/protein binding properties substantially identical to natural viral HIV gp120, which comprises fractionating a composition containing crude gp120 sequentially using (1) ion exchange chromatography, (2) hydrophobic-interaction chromatography, and (3) size exclusion filtration, collecting at each step a fraction that exhibits specific binding affinity for CD4 peptide. The process is carried out in the absence of any affinity purification steps or any steps (such as reverse-phase HPLC) that use contact protein with organic solvents. The product obtained by this method is a purified, full-length, non-fusion recombinant HIV gp120 glycoprotein having protein/protein interaction properties substantially identical to gp120 as presented on an HIV virus, including binding affinity for CD4 and binding affinity for at least one antibody capable of neutralizing HIV infectivity.
